column4: where does lilo get installed? does it create it's own directory?
why are you using lilo? grub is default boot manager in ubuntu
i am double booting between OS X and Ubuntu and refit needs lilo to work properly
ok then. lilo stores its configuration in /etc/lilo.conf
i have that file set up, but it's not recognizing linux at the refit menu
you have to run lilo after changing the file
ah, i'll try that
the problem is whenever i try to download lilo ( using 'apt-get install lilo' ) i can't get it
i get temporary error resolving archive.ubuntu.com
well it seems like Internet is not working on the machine
i am using irc on the same machine right now
and can view web pages
ok then it might be overloaded ubuntu server, try installing using synaptic, it might be proxy settings
trying...
okay synaptic worked, but do you know where it puts lilo?
run dpkg -L lilo to find out
dpkg tells me it's not installed but synaptic tells me that it is. does it matter that i am chroot'ed into a mounted partition?
synaptic was rung from chroot as well?
yes
then it shouldn't matter
let me try again
can i run synaptic from the command line? nevermind... googling now
